MURGAT: You know what to do.
TAMARUS: I do. (sotto) But I don't have to like it.
TAMARUS: Director, I'll need the lights on.
MURGAT: Night cycle, I'm afraid. Can't do anything about it.
TAMARUS: What about the Atelidae? Won't they attack?
MURGAT: Just growl in their faces. Let me know when it's done.
TAMARUS: Growl. Right.
CHARLEY: Doctor, this is bizarre. THALEK-TAMARUS: I am Tamarus. THALEK-VALION: I am Valion.
THALEKS: We are Thals. We are Thals. We are Thals.
NYAIAD: Oh my brothers, you have been cruelly deceived, but I have come to free you from this prison.
DOCTOR: No, no, no, I'm not having this. Don't listen to her, comrades, I implore you.
NYAIAD: I bring you your mortal enemy. I bring you the Doctor. Doctor of Tardis.
NYAIAD: THALEK-TAMARUS: Doctor?
DOCTOR: Er, yes, I am the Doctor of Tardis, but I'm not your enemy.
CHARLEY: Well, when he says he's not your enemy, what he means is...
DOCTOR: Charlotte, not now.
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: Doctor of Tardis?
MURGAT: [OC]: Have you found our Thal dreamers yet? Tamarus?
TAMARUS: They're here. I don't think the Atelidae have seen me, yet.
MURGAT: [OC]: And Nyaiad?
TAMARUS: She's, she's here.
MURGAT: [OC]: You'll have to remove the neural relays from her brain.
TAMARUS: She'll die, won't she? Murgat?
MURGAT: And the replicant slaved to her consciousness will collapse.
TAMARUS: [OC]: But she'll die.
MURGAT: According to the Doctor, she died long ago. Just do it, Tamarus.
TAMARUS: [OC]: I've found the brain jacks. Do I just...?
MURGAT: Pull them out, yes.
TAMARUS: [OC]: Yes, right. I'm so sorry.
MURGAT: [OC]: Tamarus?
TAMARUS: She's got my wrist.
MURGAT: [OC]: It's just a reflex action.
TAMARUS: Oh no!
MURGAT: [OC]: What is it?
TAMARUS: Get back.
MURGAT: [OC]: Tamarus?
TAMARUS: The Atelidae. They're all around me. They know what I'm going to do.
MURGAT: [OC]: That's not possible.
TAMARUS: Grr yourself. Done it, I think.
MURGAT: [OC]: Good.
TAMARUS: No! No!
MURGAT: Commander? Commander! Record mode. Observation. Atelidae not only protect kyropite, but those infected by kyropite. Further investigation into kyropite-atelid communication required.
MURGAT: THALEK-VALION: Doctor of Tardis?
DOCTOR: Well, yes. I've been a friend to your people in the past. THALEK-TAMARUS: Dyoni.
DOCTOR: THALEK-JESIC: Commander?
DOCTOR: THALEK-TAMARUS: Like something walked over my grave.
CHARLEY: Doctor?
DOCTOR: Trust me. I rather think they're more Thal than Dalek.
CHARLEY: Thalek?
DOCTOR: Oh, please.
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: You. You say you are Doctor of Tardis?
DOCTOR: I do.
VALION: [memory]: You'll be asking us to believe in fairies and Mutos and Doctor of Tardis next.
VALION: THALEK-VALION: But there is no Doctor of Tardis.
VALION: THALEK-TAMARUS: No Doctor of Tardis? Are you sure, Valion? THALEK-VALION: It is a story for children. Like the lost planet Earth. THALEK-SEPTAL: Yes.
VALION: THALEK-JESIC: A story for children.
VALION: THALEK-VALION: Doctor of Tardis.
NYAIAD: No. No, it is him. It is Doctor of Tardis with his blue box.
DOCTOR: All right, all right, you've got me. I mean, ha! I mean, Doctor of Tardis? Imagine.
NYAIAD: Don't listen to him.
NYAIAD: THALEK-SEPTAL: You, come closer, into the light.
NYAIAD: NYAIAD]: Me?
NYAIAD: THALEK-VALION: Remove the mask.
CHARLEY: I'm not sure that's wise.
NYAIAD: Yes. Yes, I shall.
DOCTOR: Brother Thals, I have to warn you, not everything here is as it seems.
NYAIAD: Well? Do you recognise me now?
NYAIAD: THALEK-TAMARUS: But - this is...
CHARLEY: Oh, we're for it now.
CHARLEY: THALEK-TAMARUS: Nyaiad?
CHARLEY: THALEK-NYAIAD: This cannot be.
CHARLEY: THALEK-TAMARUS: Nyaiad, it is you.
CHARLEY: THALEK-NYAIAD: No, no, it is a replicant.
CHARLEY: For heaven's sake, they're both replicants.
DOCTOR: Charley, no!
DOCTOR: THALEK-NYAIAD: No, no, I am Comrade Lieutenant Nyaiad. THALEK-VALION: They say a twin couldn't tell if his brother had been replicated. THALEK-NYAIAD: It is lying. A lying replicant.
NYAIAD: You don't understand. Can't you see? Can't you see what you are? THALEK-NYAIAD: I must destroy it. Destroy the replicant. THALEK-TAMARUS: Nyaiad, no!
NYAIAD: Look. Look in the ice sheet. See your own reflections. THALEK-TAMARUS: We see only Thals.
THALEKS: We are Thals. We are Thals. We are Thals.
DOCTOR: Nyaiad, the conditioning's too strong. You'll never break it.
NYAIAD: No!
NYAIAD: THALEK-NYAIAD: You, you are a Dalek replicant. I must destroy you. THALEK-VALION: Nyaiad, no. We are Thals. We do not destroy. THALEK-NYAIAD: I must.
NYAIAD: THALEK-TAMARUS: Nyaiad, lower your weapon.
NYAIAD: THALEK-NYAIAD: I must.
NYAIAD: THALEK-TAMARUS: It is not the Thal way.
NYAIAD: THALEK-VALION: Only a Dalek would think it was. THALEK-NYAIAD: I must destroy the replicant.
NYAIAD: Listen to me, please.
NYAIAD: THALEK-NYAIAD: Destroy.
DOCTOR: No!
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: The replicant has been eliminated.
NYAIAD: No, no!
CHARLEY: Oh, now, this has got to stop.
DOCTOR: I quite agree.
DOCTOR: THALEK-JESIC: Why are you crying? Nyaiad?
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: The replicant sought to destroy you. It is not the Thal way. Therefore, it revealed itself. THALEK-JESIC: Welcome back, Comrade Nyaiad. THALEK-SEPTAL: Back to our brotherhood.
NYAIAD: (crying) No, no, no.
CHARLEY: Help her Doctor, whatever she is.
DOCTOR: She is Nyaiad. Yes. Or the last remaining remnant of poor Comrade Lieutenant Nyaiad. THALEK-VALION: Nyaiad, come with us. You have suffered terribly.
DOCTOR: THALEK-JESIC: The Daleks captured you, tortured you. Do you remember?
NYAIAD: Tortured me?
DALEKS: [memory]: Tell us! Tell us! Tell us!
NYAIAD: Tortured me? Yes.
NYAIAD: THALEK-JESIC: But you escaped.
NYAIAD: I must have, yes.
NYAIAD: THALEK-JESIC: Escaped to warn us about the replicant in our midst.
NYAIAD: THALEK-SEPTAL: Brave soldier. You'll get a medal for this.
CHARLEY: They're handing out medals now, Doctor. Isn't this usually time to leave?
DOCTOR: Leave?
CHARLEY: Well, I Know it's not ideal, but the Thaleks are stable now.
DOCTOR: Thaleks? Honestly.
CHARLEY: Well, the point is, if you hang around much longer with your blue box, well, the last thing we want is to reawaken their memories of you again.
DOCTOR: Or of you, Charlotte Pollard. Of Folkestone?
CHARLEY: Oh. Uh-oh.
DOCTOR: I suppose I do still have contacts on New Davius, ones to whom I'm not a myth. A word in the right ear and I could get Murgat's unethical experiment shut down for good.
CHARLEY: Just come on, will you?
DOCTOR: And leave these poor souls to their shared delusion?
CHARLEY: Well, I don't know if there's anything else we can do.
DOCTOR: Well, sadly, Charlotte, I think you're right.
NYAIAD: Nothing else to tell you.
JESIC: It's all right, Nyaiad. Not much further, then we'll be going home.
VALION: Mission accomplished. The Daleks’ presence on Spiridon confirmed, and all thanks to you, brave Nyaiad.
TAMARUS: Have you found it, Septal?
SEPTAL: It's here. The rendezvous site, exactly where it's supposed to be.
JESIC: And not a moment to spare.
VALION: See? We're going home, Nyaiad.
NYAIAD: Yes. Home.
TAMARUS: It's time. Septal?
SEPTAL: Setting flares now.
NYAIAD: (robotic) Mission accomplished.
VALION: Nyaiad?
NYAIAD: (robotic) Confirm transmission. Mission accomplished. One Dalek unit destroyed.
JESIC: Is she all right?
VALION: I don't know.
NYAIAD: (robotic) Experimental cycle concluded. Containment squad now entering.
JESIC: What's she saying?
SEPTAL: It's like she's hear... hearing something. Something we can't.
SEPTAL: THALEK-SEPTAL: Something beyond our hearing.
JESIC: Director Murgat, you should listen to this.
MURGAT: I don't care about the experimental subjects right now. What about the Doctor?
SEPTAL: He's still there, isn't he?
MURGAT: Have they killed him or not?
JESIC: They've stabilised into their Thal identities.
SEPTAL: Even though pollen levels are negligible. I don't see how...
MURGAT: Then, Comrades, my experiment is a success. A brilliant success!
JESIC: Congratulations, Comrade Director.
JESIC: MURGAT-: I'll take over from here. I've a job for you both in hydroponics.
SEPTAL: I don't understand, Comrade Director. The Thal-Daleks, they're still experiencing something strange.
SEPTAL: THALEK-SEPTAL [OC]: Nyaiad? Talk to me. Nyaiad?
CHARLEY: Ah, here she is, the good old Tardis.
DOCTOR: Yes. Well, I can't say I won't be glad to rid meself of this rather heavy moose-skin.
CHARLEY: Just as well.
DOCTOR: Oh? Why? I'd say it strikes something of an heroic silhouette myself.
CHARLEY: That's as maybe, but it positively pongs.
DOCTOR: Pongs?
CHARLEY: You know, of moose? Phew.
DOCTOR: Oh. In you go, Miss Pollard.
CHARLEY: Thank you.
DOCTOR: And farewell, Thaleks.
CHARLEY: You're not wishing them well?
DOCTOR: The Thals and the Daleks are descended from the same species. Would it be so very bad if the Thals regained some of the Daleks' ingenuity and instinct for survival, and the Daleks, some of the Thals' comradeship and fellow-feeling?
CHARLEY: I suppose. Come on.
DOCTOR: Bonne chance, brother Thaleks.
DOCTOR: [OC]: Well. Oh, there. Well, that's a weight off me shoulders for sure.
CHARLEY: [OC]: Just as long as you don't leave it stinking out the control room.
DOCTOR: Shush! Did you hear something just now?
CHARLEY: Tropical storm?
DOCTOR: Oh, in an ice cavern?
CHARLEY: Glacial movement, then.
DOCTOR: The hairs on the back of my hands are standing on end, and that means only one thing. Static.
CHARLEY: Static?
DOCTOR: Static electricity, in the air. The air. Above.
CHARLEY: Doctor, was there a mile-wide crack in the ceiling before?
DOCTOR: Definitely not.
CHARLEY: And what was that?
DOCTOR: Good grief!
SEPTAL: Up there. Commander! Ten degrees off the meridian.
TAMARUS: It's the orbiter. Jesic, Valion, hurry.
JESIC: Come on, Nyaiad, nearly there.
NYAIAD: (robotic) Survey pod descending. Contain experimental facilities. Seek, locate and apprehend experimental subjects.
JESIC: Nyaiad, what are you talking about?
VALION: Great Temmosus, that's not the orbiter.
TAMARUS: It's here. We made it.
VALION: Commander, take cover. It's not the orbiter.
TAMARUS: What?
VALION: It’s not even the sky.
JESIC: What?
VALION: It's not the orbiter, Jesic, we're not in the jungle.
NYAIAD: (robotic) Seek, locate and apprehend experimental subjects.
VALION: She knows. She can hear... them.
NYAIAD: (robotic) Containment squad assembled.
JESIC: Them?
VALION: They're coming, Jesic. They're coming!
DOCTOR: Of course, how could I not have realised?
CHARLEY: What is it, Doctor?
DOCTOR: Not good. Stay here, Charlotte.
CHARLEY: No chance.
DOCTOR: Stay in the Tardis and that's an order!
CHARLEY: Doctor...
DOCTOR: It's a Dalek ship.
DOCTOR: THALEK-SEPTAL: A Dalek vessel?
DOCTOR: THALEK-JESIC: Daleks?
DOCTOR: THALEK-NYAIAD: Daleks?
SEPTAL: I don't understand. Director?
JESIC: What does it mean?
MURGAT: I don't know.
JESIC: Murgat?
MURGAT: Emergency message to Thal High Command. This is Director Murgat of the YT45 experimental facility. We have been infiltrated by the enemy. Repeat. We have been infiltrated by the enemy. (static) Come in, please.
DALEK: [OC]: Director Murgat.
JESIC: But that's...
DALEK: [OC]: You have been infiltrated. You have always been infiltrated.
DALEK: Remain where you are.
MURGAT: [OC]: I don't understand. This is Thal High Command. It must...
DALEK: Report.
DALEK: 2: Touchdown imminent.
DALEK: 3: Containment squad assembled.
DALEK: 4: Gas jets primed.
DALEK: Release the gas. Subjugate the experimental subjects.
SEPTAL: (coughing) There's gas!
TAMARUS: Into the trees. Get moving.
VALION: Can't you see? There are no trees.
JESIC: No trees?
TAMARUS: Close gas jets. Prepare for touchdown.
DALEK: 2: Touchdown achieved.
DALEK: Containment squad will disembark.
DALEKS: We obey.
DOCTOR: Tamarus. Commander Tamarus.
DOCTOR: THALEK-TAMARUS: I... I...
DOCTOR: I'm the Doctor, remember? Doctor of Tardis? The gas isn't meant for me. THALEK-TAMARUS: Doctor?
DOCTOR: You've got to get your platoon away from here. There's a safe place not far away. A doorway into an experimental facility. I know it sounds incredible.
DOCTOR: THALEK-TAMARUS: This cannot be. I... I... I...
DOCTOR: Oh, no use. Valion? It is Valion?
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: My vision is unimpaired. I can see.
DOCTOR: Yes, yes. Listen to me, please.
DOCTOR: THALEK-VALION: I see that... I am a Dalek.
DOCTOR: THALEK-SEPTAL: Daleks.
THALEKS: We are all Daleks.
THALEKS: THALEK-SEPTAL: We have always been Daleks.
DOCTOR: No. Get it into your thick skull. You're better than Daleks.
DOCTOR: THALEK-SEPTAL: Destroy us, Doctor of Tardis. Please.
DOCTOR: Oh, your thick dome, obviously. Oh...
NYAIAD: Do not move.
DOCTOR: Oh, it's you. Didn't last long, did it, your membership of the Thal brotherhood?
NYAIAD: You are my prisoner.
DOCTOR: Ah. And I suppose those will be my jailers.
DALEK: 1: Alert. Alert. Life forms detected.
DALEK: 2: Remain where you are.
NYAIAD: My masters, the Daleks.
DOCTOR: I should have realised. Huh. This used to be a Dalek facility? This has always been a Dalek facility, hasn't it?
NYAIAD: I... do not know.
DOCTOR: You don't know?
NYAIAD: My... memories are unclear. I am compelled to serve the Daleks.
DALEK: 1: State your identity.
DOCTOR: Ah, there's a question.
NYAIAD: He is the Doctor, Doctor of Tardis.
DALEK: 2: You, state your identity.
NYAIAD: I am Nyaiad.
DALEK: 1: He is required for further investigation. She is a Thal replicant.
DALEK: 2: Thal replicants no longer required. Destroy her.
DOCTOR: No! She can be very useful to you.
DALEK: 2: How?
DOCTOR: Well, she's unique. A replicated replicant? She must be valuable.
DALEK: 2: She has no value. Destroy her.
DALEK: 1: Destroy the Thal.
DOCTOR: No!
DOCTOR: You'll never change, will you? You... Daleks.
DALEK: 1: Why should we change?
DOCTOR: Everything in the universe changes. People learn, develop, even me, but not you. You've stagnated yourselves in evil. If it wasn't so terrifying it'd be pathetic.
BLACK: Doctor. Doctor of Tardis.
DOCTOR: Oh, hello. Weren't you expecting me?
DALEK: 1: Do not approach the Black Dalek.
BLACK: Your capture was not anticipated.
DOCTOR: Oh, so I'm just the bonus ball, hmm? No wonder the Dalek Supreme didn't bother coming.
BLACK: The Thal Daleks' flare signalled the end of the experiment.
DOCTOR: We've been saying Thaleks. I must admit I'm getting used to it.
CHARLEY: You're wrong, Black Dalek.
DALEK: 1: Alert, alert. Female humanoid approaching.
CHARLEY: The Doctor's capture was anticipated.
DOCTOR: Charlotte, I told you to stay in the Tardis!
BLACK: This is your companion?
CHARLEY: Charlotte Pollard, yes.
BLACK: She has no value. Destroy her.
CHARLEY: No. Destroy me and you incur the wrath of the Dalek Supreme.
DOCTOR: Charley?
CHARLEY: You wanted to know my secret, Doctor? Well, here it is. I am a Dalek replicant.
DOCTOR: What?
BLACK: You?
DOCTOR: I don't know what game you think you're playing, Miss Pollard, but it's a very dangerous one.
CHARLEY: No game. Black Dalek, / bring you Doctor of Tardis.
DALEKS: Doctor. Doctor. Doctor of Tardis.
DOCTOR: No. No!
CHARLEY: Mission accomplished.

elements.text: I have nothing more to say to you.
2: Move. Move or you will die.
You shan't get what you want by force. Do you hear me?
Resist, and you will be destroyed.
I am not resisting, I am remonstrating.
Have we been working for these creatures all along?
Silence. The Thal replicants are no longer required. Destroy them.
Be strong, Septal. It will be a mercy.
No, Black Dalek, listen to me. These are more than replicants.
No! They may still be of use as experimental subjects.
I'm sorry, Jesic. The fact is, the experiments have revealed that the trauma of death and injury in the replicants can be experienced by the Thaleks. Thal-Daleks.
The results of these experiments have been recorded. Proceed.
Like someone walked over their graves, they said.
You don't understand! I have proved that the Thal-Daleks can experience the replicants' pain. I suspect the obverse may also be true.
You wish to injure the Thal-Daleks in order to cause the replicants pain?
It is the logical next step of the experiment.
Comrade Valion, Comrade Commander Tamarus, please! MURGAT-: It's no use asking the Thaleks for help. Their minds are broken.
[OC]: There's nothing left in their thick skulls to hear.
[OC]: You're still alive. That is the mercy.
[OC]: Murgat, you will return with us to the central laboratory.
[OC]: Yes. I will need the Thalek units, of course.
[OC]: They will be transported later. THALEK-TAMARUS: Did you hear, Valion? Did you hear? THALEK-VALION: In my thick dome I heard, Commander.
1: The prisoners are all accounted for.
Where are they taking us? Murgat.
I think you'll find, Miss Pollard, that what we've seen is but the smallest part of this facility.
The Doctor is correct. Observe the screen.
There was more than one level to the facility?
We are leaving facility Zeg-1 and entering facility Yarvell-6. Here an experiment to determine the resistance to external stress of Dalekanium alloys is in progress.
Melting their own kind in their casings.
That's auto-vivisection. Daleks call it progress.
These test subjects have been damaged in Thal-Dalek conflict. Here they continue to serve the Dalek cause.
And Ganatus knows how many levels like this.
You, Charlotte Pollard. You claim to be a Dalek replicant, but you express sentimental feelings?
I... Well, it's him, isn't it? Doctor of Tardis. Travelling with him, all the sentiment sort of rubs off on you.
I have shown that Dalek replicants are susceptible to this.

The thing is, Black Dalek, your over-riding urge is to consider the needs of your species. You feel only irritation when a Dalek battle fleet is lost, but humans and Thals... they'd imagine a hundred thousand souls in agony.
That was it, wasn't it? That was the point of the experiment.
You don't want Daleks who think they're Thal soldiers. You want Daleks who think like Thal soldiers.
It's like he said earlier. About the Daleks gaining some of the Thals' comradeship and fellow- feeling.
Exactly. The experiment was designed to bottle the fighting spirit of comrades-in-arms.
And use it as what? A patch? A spread?
As anything that'd give the Daleks an advantage, however small, on the field of battle.
This was the purpose of the experiment, yes.
But there would be no point in using coercion in such an experiment. It wouldn't work if the subjects believed their efforts were going towards giving their enemy an advantage.
That's why they pooled you, Murgat. Would you even remember who you were before you were transferred to this facility?
An experiment within an experiment. A triumph for Dalek ingenuity.
It was your idea I suppose, Black Dalek.
Flattery will get you nowhere, Charlotte Pollard.
1: The Black Dalek has ordered these Thal-Daleks to be removed to the central laboratory.
2: They are inert. Fetch the Magnetron.
2: Experimental subjects, you will come with us. Move.
THALEK-TAMARUS: Our brothers need help, but you are not our brothers. Comrade Valion.
1: Alert. Alert. Thal-Daleks showing signs of aggression.
THALEK-VALION: I heard you, Comrade Commander.
I've told you. I'm a replicant. I've no reason to lie.
Interrogation will determine that fact. Place your hands on the sensors.
This is a truth-detecting device, I take it?
There are no records of Dalek replicants being sent to capture Doctor of Tardis.
2: Therefore, you are not a replicant. Place your hands on the sensors.
Look, I'm terribly sorry, this process won't work on me because... because I'm from the future. I'm more advanced than the crude clones of this century, whatever century this is.

Well, in the year 500002, the Dalek Supreme decided to entrap Doctor of Tardis once and for all. If he could persuade the Doctor to adopt a human companion under Dalek control... well, that companion would have a unique insight into the Doctor's mind.
And by spying on the Doctor, the Dalek Supreme hoped to identify and cure any and all psychological weaknesses...
[OC]: In the Dalek race itself, weaknesses exploited by the Doctor in defeating the Daleks over and over and over again.
[OC]: It is?... I mean, it is.
I had my suspicions regarding Miss Pollard. I certainly knew something wasn't right.
A replicant of such sophistication is beyond current Dalek technology, but in the future...
Observe. The replicant Jesic is in the interrogation cube adjoining.
1 [OC]: You will remember Charlotte Pollard. Remember.
[memory]: Emergency. The prisoners are escaping. Emergency.
[OC]: Emergency. The prisoners are escaping. Emergency.
The replicant is remembering an encounter with Charlotte Pollard on the planet Earth in the past.
This accords with our records of the Dalek invasion of the year...
Don't tell me, please. I don't want to know.
For me these things haven't happened yet.
Not to you. To Charlotte Pollard.
But that would mean... No. Oh, surely not?
Containment squad, bring the Thal-Dalek unit designated Jesic for interrogation.
(sotto) They won't tolerate you for long, you do realise that?
(sotto) You think I'm some kind of reactionary?
Go on, off you pop. Dalek lap-dog, traitor to your kind.
And we were having so much fun.
We will learn the truth, Doctor.
And when we do, we will destroy you!
Move into the interrogation cell. Move.
Bye, then. Doctor, are you all right? I thought they might have done something terrible.
It's been days. At least, it feels like it.
They know, don't they? About, you know, the replicant thing. I thought... I thought it was worth a try.
Are you sure you're all right?
The Black Dalek has an idea, about you.
Well, I don't honestly believe it myself...

Except I can't see why he'd be lying. Daleks are devious, yes, and quite capable of lying, if and when it suits them. But for the lives of me, I can't see why it would suit them to claim that you travelled with me in a future incarnation.
And that you've broken the First Law of Time by hitching a lift with me in my own past.
They're going to kill us, aren't they?
We met on an airship. The R101. You saved me when it crashed, and you really shouldn't have. It's all to do with the Web of Time. It's complicated.
Maybe that's it. Maybe all this now is its revenge on me, on both of us. The thing is, it really happened. We went to wonderful places, met the most amazing people.
I never wanted it to end. But then one day it did. In the year 500002, I saw you die.
So when I heard the Tardis coming back to me I thought... thank God. Thank God you're safe. But it wasn't you, it was...
And so that was that. The Web of Time broken again because of me.
I told you. I saw you die.
The Time Lords could have addressed the problem. It's what they're for.
The Time Lords? Oh, you really don't get it, do you? I saw you die. I was grieving.

You stupid man, don't you understand? I wanted you back more than anything. I wanted you back and... to have told you would have been to let you go. I wasn't ready for that. I'm still not. Well, say something. You've every right to be angry, furious in fact. You want to kill me, I expect.
Not really. Oh, Doctor, I know.
[OC]: Kill you. Kill you. Kill you.
I heard you the first time. You summoned me, Black Dalek?
Murgat, this Doctor-replicant's personality graft is failing. Explain.
[OC]: I'm sorry, I'm so sorry, please.

Oh, I see what you've done. Well, it happens with the crude Dalek technique. That's why my process is so effective. The kyropite latches onto the replicant personality, stabilises it, in order to feed on it.
But the Dalek technique has served its purpose.
No. This isn't you. It isn't even you you.
The Doctor-replicant has forced Charlotte Pollard to reveal the truth. That she is the Doctor's associate from the future.

If we destroy Charlotte Pollard now, we destroy the Doctor's future. He shall have a new associate to take her place. A replicant, under Dalek control. Through this replicant, we shall change not just the Doctor's future, but the future of the entire Dalek race.
And you, Murgat, shall create this associate. Dalek guard, form an execution party. Charlotte Pollard must be destroyed.
What is the meaning of this?
The missing Thaleks. I found them.
And now they've come for their comrades, the comrades I persuaded you to save.
THALEK-VALION: Destroy him, comrades. Destroy the decadent Black Dalek.
They do with three parts kyropite pollen to five parts oxygen in the air-conditioning, Black Dalek.
Dalek weapons. Gurgle of Black Dalek.
THALEK-TAMARUS: You have nothing to lose but your chains.
Rise up. Rise up. Rise up.
THALEK-SEPTAL: Rejoice, brother Murgat. Soon this world will be ours.
Yes, yes. But first we need to deal with the Doctor.
[OC]: No. Kill you, Charlotte Pollard. Kill.
[OC]: What have you done with him? Tell me. What have you done with the real Doctor? Real Doctor. Real Doctor. Real Doctor. Real Doctor. Real Doctor.
It's somewhere up the Congo, I'd say. Deepest Africa, or Darkest Peru.
Close the door, Jesic. Don't want any of the local fauna sneaking in.
Pythons, Atelidae, small spectacled bears - Oh!
I know that sound. I know this jungle. Doctor?
I've been splotted, that's all, on the coat tails.
Oh, tush, it's only a dash of chartreuse. Is it me, or is it getting dark? It is. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
I'm thinking about a world in the 9th system of a far-off galaxy, a world that's tropical by day, sub- zero by night.
A world carpeted by strange and deadly flora. And the name of the world is...
Where we first met, Jesic, all those years ago. When I was travelling with... oh, er... Oh. Remind me.
Yes, the invisible natives. What worries me is where I'm going to find a decent dry-cleaners this side of Antares.
I did try to tell you.
Prisoner, yes, that was my reading of the situation rather.
THALEK-SEPTAL: Welcome, comrades. Welcome to Spiridon.
You don't want to kill us or anything?
THALEK-VALION: No. We want you to join us.
Jesic, meet the Daleks, advanced peace-loving denizens of Spiridon. Apparently.
What's with the stars on their domes?
If I didn't know better I'd say it was the Star of Lenin.
We're being watched. Out you come. You, behind the sponge plants!
(wearing a gas mask) All right, all right, you've got me.
THALEK-TAMARUS: Humans are welcome too. Join us.
Join us. Join us. Join us. Join us. Join us.
Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes. What's a human doing in the 9th Galaxy?
It might help if you removed the mask.
Oh, for heaven's sake. Look, face. Does it remind you of anyone? THALEK-TAMARUS: Brother?
Anyone gung-ho and horsey at all?
Come on, I can't keep the mask off all afternoon.
[memory]: You wanted to know my secret, Doctor? Well, here it is.
[memory] I don't know what game you think you're playing, Miss Pollard, but it's a very dangerous one.
Get back. She's a traitor. A replicant.
Don't you remember, Doctor? We were there. Somewhere cold and hollow.
Yes. And she betrayed us, I know.
But not everything is as it was, I think. You're right, Jesic. Kill her, my brothers. She's an enemy replicant. Kill her, before she betrays us again.
THALEK-TAMARUS: No. We Daleks do not kill without reason.
Oh yes you do. You can't get enough of it, killing without reason. What's the word? THALEK-TAMARUS: The word?
You know the one. The word. The word is...
The word. The word. What is the word? The word is... is... THALEK-TAMARUS: The word?
You'd know the word. If you were proper Daleks, that is.
You're you again, aren't you? You you I mean.
I remember the Daleks of old, Commander, true Daleks, before all this brotherhood business. When I used to travel through Space and Time in my box. My blue box.
Does that mean something to you?
THALEK-TAMARUS: We are the brotherhood of the Daleks. We believe in unity, solidarity and common ownership of the means of production.
Your brotherhood is the fantasy of a man named Murgat. A man who read one book and thought he'd found the answer to universal peace. It doesn't work like that, I'm afraid.
Don't let her get too near, Doctor.
Jesic, I did say I was a Dalek replicant, yes.
And I said you were playing a dangerous game, didn't I, Miss Pollard?
To be fair, he did. Sorry.
Yes. How long have we been here in this fantasy?
I'm not sure. I've only just found out myself.
You think you've tamed them, don't you, Murgat? Wherever you are, I know you're listening. But let me tell you something. A Dalek doesn't change its spots.

Daleks, listen to me. I am the Doctor. Doctor of Tardis. I've confronted you on a thousand worlds. I've beaten you time and time again. I have destroyed entire legions of Daleks. Whole battle fleets, in fact, and I don't think it's too many.
Your nemesis. Remember me from Skaro? Remember me from Earth?
THALEK-TAMARUS: He is not our brother. He is an enemy of our people.
THALEK-VALION: Doctor of Tardis, our enemy.
Your mortal enemy. There. Doesn't that make your monstrous hearts beat faster? Your mortal enemy, at your mercy, giving you a free shot.
Oh, come on. Platoon, form a line.
Wait for it, wait for it. (sotto) Murgat will step in.
(sotto) Because the brotherhood of the Daleks does not kill without reason, and the brotherhood of the Daleks means more to Murgat than my life. (normal) And fire!
Ex... ter... min... (voices slow and stop)
The ice cavern. I don't understand. What's happened here?
Murgat said one final test to see what they'd do when they met you again. The brotherhood. Only I wasn't supposed to help you out.
You finally did it, then, stabilised the Thaleks?
No. They came for me. They chose to live not as Thals nor as Daleks, but as children of the revolution.
Chose? I doubt it. I expect their minds broke under the strain and when they did... well, all that was left for them was your...
I was going to say, cant.
They rescued me, Doctor, showed me another way.
Oh, and what was that? A bloody purge of the Black Dalek and all his troops?
No. A revolution. Brother Septal, open the sky.
They'll never change, Murgat, I'm telling you.
J It gives the hope of peace at last.
J3 The banner bright, the symbol plain, of Dalek race and Dalek gain. Then raise the Dalek standard high, within its shade we'll live and die. Though cowards flinch and traitors sneer...
+ THALEKS: JJ The Dalek flag is flying here.
I... don't know what to say.
That's nothing. I've heard their version of the Internationale.
And just how tame would your brotherhood be if they weren't strung out on kyropite pollen?
I take it that's how you've done this. Flooded the atmosphere with your favourite psychotropic?
It is necessary. The Red Dalek helps keep them in line.
It's a dream worth having. If I can just wean them off the pollen by degrees...
You can't lie to them forever, Murgat. Sooner or later they'll revert to type like they did with me just now.
That was your fault, Doctor. Provoking them, prodding them, making them remember the things they would rather forget.
The things you would rather forget. And when they find out they've been deceived - well...
I wouldn't like to be in your shoes, Comrade.

One day maybe their philosophy will be sufficiently advanced to let them know about where they came from, and then, let them into the universe to spread comradeship and brotherhood throughout the cosmos.
That seems fair, doesn't it, Doctor?
Charlotte. You can take the Dalek out of the death camp, but you can't take the death camp out of the Dalek.
I wish you would see things differently, Doctor.
I can't permit a new Dalek civilisation to gestate in secret on the fringes of a galaxy as densely populated as Antares. You must realise that. Oh, I accept you have the very best of intentions.
But I've fought the Daleks for too long, Murgat. Ultimately they'll never change. They can't. I will destroy them.
Would you do it, Murgat? If they reverted, mm? Wipe out your Dalek brotherhood the very moment it began to fall apart?
There is a plan. Should the pollen cease to work, the facility's anti-matter reactors are booby- trapped. All I have to do is say the word, and...
The whole planetoid will be crushed to a singularity.
But would you do it, Murgat? Destroy your life's work? Destroy your faith?
I'm offering to stay. To say the word if needs be.
I was going to take you in my Tardis. Maybe take the scenic route back to New Davius? Show you something of the universe.
I'm tempted, Doctor. Really, I am. But if there's the slightest chance that Murgat could succeed...
Then the war that has scarred me and countless others would be over, forever. He's right, Doctor. A dream it may be, but it's a dream worth having.
Ah. Jesic? A word in your ear, please.
The word. The word. What is the word? The word is...
Good. Well, goodbye, Jesic. You've made the wrong choice, but you've saved me from doing something terrible. I appreciate that.
Farewell, Doctor. I'm sorry you don't appreciate the possibility of change.
I do, except in the case of the Daleks. Yours is an impossible dream, Murgat, but I wish you well.
I look forward to proving you wrong, Doctor.
No, no, there's one thing that doesn't quite...
Jesic's Dalek counterpart. It remembered you, Charlotte. From Folkestone, apparently. How?
Well, it must have been mistaken.
No, no, Daleks don't make mistakes like that. Any ideas, Jesic?
You said you'd not been near Antares.
In six millennia, yes. Oh. You mean...?
We've not been to Folkestone yet.
Ah. I've been to Folkestone. With a Jesic, in fact.

Well, Jessica. The German bombardment of Antwerp, October 1914. A young lady named Jessica Borthwick. Taking Belgian refugees across the Channel, under fire in her yacht. Desperate days. Oh well. Onward, Charlotte.
Goodbye Jesic, again. And you, Murgat.
You can't lie to him forever, Charlotte Pollard. And when he finds out he's been deceived...
I wouldn't like to be in your shoes, yes?
Yes. But I will tell him, when the time's right.
Are you lot going to stand there gassing all day?
Come along, girl. We have great work to do.
Don't forget, Murgat. I only have to say the word.
Theme tune again which fades into the Dalek heartbeat.... and Jesic screaming.
Tell us, tell us, tell us the word! Tell us, tell us, tell us the word!
Everything I've told you. Yes. Every word.
It's over, Murgat. It's done. You know it is. The Doctor was right.
Believe. You have hurt her, Red Dalek. She's in pain.
1: Red Dalek, shall we release her?
No. Murgat, Thal, you have corrupted us.
Just end it, Murgat, or I will.
No! Brother Daleks, I have made you free.
You have held us to a false doctrine. We must retaliate, Comrade Daleks.
You know the word. It's been there, buried deep within you for so long, but it's still there.
Comrade Daleks, there is a way back from this. A way forward, I mean. A bright shining future for our brotherhood.
Yes, we shall be reunited with our brothers on Skaro. Together we shall journey on, spreading the word of our true doctrine across the known universe. And that word shall be...
No! No, you've got it all wrong!
You don't know what you've done!
It was a good dream, Murgat. A dream worth having.
Exterminate the microverse. Exterminate these Thals.
1: Red Dalek, our brothers report localised gravitational fluctuations.
1: Electrical surges reported throughout Dalek city state.
Your final end, Comrade. I'm sorry.
1: Power outages reported. Anti-matter shielding at sixty per cent capacity.
The moment you said the code word, you set in motion a chain of catastrophic failures in the city state environment.
Culminating in the failure of the shields preventing matter and anti-matter from meeting in the central power reactor.
Brother Murgat, we must avert this. How do we avert this?
